inclusion.criterion: Fulfilled criteria for the diagnosis of severe preeclampsia
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Diagnostic criteria for severe preeclampsia(one of the following): Blood pressure of 160 mm Hg systolic or higher or 110 mm Hg diastolic or higher on two occasions at least 6 hours apart while the patient is on bed rest (unless antihypertensive therapy is intiated befor this time).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: New onset Cerebral or visual disturbances.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Sever persistant epigastric or right upper-quadrant pain unresponsive to medication and not accounted for by alternative diagnosis, or both.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Impaired liver function as indicated by abnormally elevated blood concentration of liver enzymes (to twic normal concentration).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Thrombocytopenia (platlet count less than 100, 000 per microliter.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Diagnostic criteria for HELLP syndrome: Hemolysis documented by an increased LDH level and progressive anemia .
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Thrombocytopenia is subclassified as class one HELLP syndrome: platelet nadir ≤50, 000 cells/mm³, class two HELLP syndrome: platelet nadir ≤100, 000 cells/mm³, or class three HELLP syndrome: platelet nadir ≤150, 000 cells/mm³..
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Anticepation of Microangiopathic Hemolytic Anemia: Thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura-hemolytic uremic syndrome should be considered in all pregnant women with severe thrombocytopenia, severe anemia, and elevated lactate dehydrogenase enzyme.
inclusion.label: met

notes: The patient is a 23-year-old man who came to the hospital with high blood pressure (175/95 mmHg) and signs of septicemia. He developed respiratory failure requiring mechanical ventilation and renal failure requiring hemodialysis.
